body:
**Shading Designer** I'm having an issue when the number of shades is set to 1 on the ladybug shading designer (vertical orientation).   The error code is "1. Solution exception:iteration over non-sequence of type NoneType" The component works when the number of shades is set to 2, but that's not what I'm looking for. The horizontal shading is working correctly. **Relating to the Daylight Simulation.** I'm also getting the error "1. Solution exception:'NoneType' object has no attribute 'UserDictionary'", more specifcally: Runtime error (MissingMemberException): 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'UserDictionary'
Traceback:
line 7374, in callFromHoneybeeHive, "<string>"
line 1602, in writeRADAndMaterialFiles, "<string>"
line 193, in main, "<string>"
line 258, in script I think it has something to do with the rad material assigned to the shades, because when I disconnect them from the simulation, it works fine.
topic: Errors with Vertical Shading and Daylight Simulation

replies.body:
1. I would generate two shadings and then pick the first one.

2. It looks like one of the inputs to HBObjects is None.
